questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of photosynthesis in plants?
options: To absorb water from the soil
To convert light energy into chemical energy
To release nitrogen into the atmosphere
To produce heat for the plant
questions.explanation: During photosynthesis, light energy is converted into chemical energy stored in glucose.

questions.question_text: Which of the following substances are the main reactants of photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: Plants use carbon dioxide from the air and water from the soil as reactants in photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: Explain why chlorophyll is important for photosynthesis.
questions.expected_answer: Chlorophyll absorbs light energy, mainly from the blue and red parts of the spectrum, which is then used to drive the chemical reactions of photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: A plant is placed in a dark room for several days. Which of the following is the most likely result?
options: The plant will increase the rate of photosynthesis.
The plant will carry out photosynthesis using heat instead of light.
The plant's rate of photosynthesis will decrease significantly.
The plant will produce more chlorophyll to compensate.
questions.explanation: Without light, photosynthesis slows or stops because light energy is required to power the reactions.

questions.question_text: A student claims that photosynthesis only benefits plants. Do you agree? Justify your answer.
questions.expected_answer: No. Photosynthesis also benefits animals and humans by producing oxygen for respiration and forming the base of most food chains by creating organic molecules.

criteria: Mentions food/energy source or food chains
